Be careful the paths are multiple but some are completely impassable. It's up to you to know how to use the satellite mode of the GPS to make your way. We did it with an 8m PL. To envisage holds is on slope. The place is dirty (fishing place ...)

title: (5340) - Azibo

title: (5340) Macedo de Cavaleiros -

name: Azibo Reservoir Protected Landscape

title: (5340) Azibo - Azibo

title: (5340) - Unnamed Road

title_short: (5340-410) Rau da Capela - 62 Rua Eira da Portela

title_short: (5385) Torre de Dona Chama - 98 Rua São Brás

title: (5370-408) Mirandela - N15
description: Free parking for city tours and ancient bridge.

title: (5370) Mirandela -

title: (5370-201) Mirandela - 231 Alameda Rio Tua
description: Parking next to the Tua river. Quiet place with shade of trees.

title: () Izeda - 13-14 Largo do Toural
description: The pitch is straight and there is enough space for several campers. There is a waste water disposal station and a possibility to fill up with fresh water. The place is in the town center and if you walk down the street in the direction of “Marktplatz”, there is a permanently installed dixi toilet 200m away. I stayed for one night and it was very quiet and pleasant, I highly recommend.

title: (5370-285) Mirandela -
description: Parque Verde da city with many activities and a lot of space next to the Padaria river, gasoline pumps and public toilets (dated at night), soccer field, tênis and river praia

name: 3 Rios Maravilha
title: () 3 Rios Maravilha
description: Campsite with camper van reception. Giant swimming pool in the campsite (provide supplement for the swimming pool) very pleasant during the hot summer months. On the other hand, isolated from the city.

title: (5200) Mogadouro - N216
description: Close to the N216 bridge, below on a road that has been flooded. Quiet area for swimming. We did not sleep there but no ban.

title: () Remondes - N216
description: Very quiet night. Very isolated place along the Rio Sabor. Road that was submerged after the construction of the new bridge. Just after the bridge coming from Pinhero but the same exists on the other side. Very quiet place, nice view. Very little passage on the bridge. Some fishermen in the morning. Place to keep clean. Win waste and toilet paper please. Suitable for small vans (narrow road to turn around)

title: (5300) Sortes - M1051
description: A spacious parking lot in a quiet village. Quite level.

title: (5300) Sortes - EM528
description: Parking in a small village easily accessible. At the start of the 14km PR2 loop. Very calm. No services (except garbage cans).

title: (5300) Rebordãos - Unnamed Road
description: Sanctuary parking senhora da serra aloft. Many grassy sites, with panoramic 360 ° views. Magnificent sunset. For all vehicles. Water available several faucets. Sunday afternoon baptisms at the church but in the evening we were alone.

title: (5370) Rio Torto - N213
description: Nice surprise this morning when this place was revealed to us on waking. We fell there by chance in the middle of the night at the end of a path without seeing where we really were ... Riverside, calm with a disused mill. Very nice site.

title: (5350-022) Alfândega da Fé - R1 de Maio

title: (5370) - 39 Rua Gricha

We were here today, but have no way of driving to the place because our camper with a trailer is too big... We were right in front of the bridge to the site

title: (5300) - N206

name: Parque de campismo e caravanismo do Rabaçal

title: (5430) - R206
description: Picnic area overlooking a busy road during the day. We stayed for the night. No noise.

title: (5300) Nogueira - N206

title: (5430) Barreiros - R. Principal

title: (5385) - 14 Largo Aguieira
description: An exceptional natural place near a chapel. A breathtaking view! And absolute calm. The little old man who maintains the chapel was very friendly and even offered to supply us with water. The last hectometres are on a stony path but passable by most vehicles. Big favorite!

title: (5430) Valpaços - Unnamed Road
description: For lunch break or more, no prohibition sign, beautiful view, too bad, not very clean

title: (5370) -
description: Beatiful climbing and take-off site for paragliders, near which it should be possible to stay the night, under the pines (no prohibitions mentioned). Superb panoramic view, however a little spoiled by the electricity poles. I still recommend it in the middle of summer because it faces the south! And watch out for the access road (4-5 km from the village of Passos) which is an unpaved forest track, lots of stones so not for low cars.

title: (5300) Nogueira - Unnamed Road
description: Car park of the Sanctuario de nossa Senhora da cabeca chapel. 360 view. Large flat gravel and grass parking lot. Very rare passages

title: (5200) Santo André -

title: (5335) - N103
description: Road N103, 61km West Bragenza, nice, flat, top hill, short unpaved road, place with 360° free view, very quiet.

title: (5430) - N103

name: Parque Campismo de Mogadouro
title: (5200-202) Parque Campismo de Mogadouro
description: Well-kept municipal campsite, clean sanitary facilities, washing machine. In addition to the municipal sports park with swimming pool, guests can collect free cards at the reception. Very friendly and helpful managers. Baker arrives at camp around 9 am with freshly baked rolls.

title: (5360-303) Vila Flor - 57 Avenida Marechal Carmona

title: (5360-396) Vila Flor - 6 Rua Doutor Monteiro
description: Car park located under the exhibition center on the terrace, a restaurant bar 100m away and a food truck permanently on the lowest terrace, beautiful view of some dog barking in the distance at night, flat and paved car park about 100 places but deserted if not exhibition, 2 steps from the city, recommended by the mayor and the police, accessible to all vehicles, even the longest

title: (5300) Bragança - Unnamed Road
description: Large car park near a chapel. A belvedere offers you an unprecedented view of Braganca and the citadel. The site is in the heights, very quiet, even if you can hear the noise of the highway in the distance. The ground is not completely flat. The absence of trees can be prohibitive in the summer season.

title_short: (5300) Bragança - 9 Avenida Engenheiro Amaro da Costa

Probably unadvised to park when there's a service expected (i.e. Saturday night/Sunday morning and major feasts). A lovely over to the mountains and castle nearby. No facilities but great 5G.

title: (5300) Gondesende - N103
description: On Chaves road, turn right, 150m, fairly flat and wide, ideal for picnic or night ...

title: (5300-252) Bragança - 4 Jardim António José D'Almeida
description:
A pipe protrudes lonely from the ground, with a tap and screw connection.
 good for a hose in the parking lot next to it

title: (5300) Bragança - Rua da Figueira
description: Place in the countryside without installation. We hear the river and goats with their bell on the mountain opposite. Some houses on the mountain opposite. Place very close to the castle of bragança. Only problem, water treatment plant next, so in the direction of the wind, there can be bad smells ...

title: (5370) Franco - 11 Largo Franco
description: The tap in the public square is available to travelers. You have enough space to park large vehicles. We have seen semi-trailers pull up in this lovely town for food. You have a restaurant but also a cafe available. The COSTA café is run by a charming couple who speak French and will offer you a pleasant moment of discovery of Portuguese culture. Possibility to buy homemade olive oil, port, honey, and grape jam. And depending on the season of the sausages. Stop doing without hesitation! :)

title: (5320) - N103
description: Place on the road between vinhais and chaves road very little passing, a little away at the top of a bend. Breathtaking panoramas. Place for several vehicles. Provide holds.

title: (5320) Vinhais - N103
description: Stop on the right tarmac car park (possible to sleep there) and the stream to cool off.

title: (5430) Lebução - 13 Estrada Nacional
description: Small car park just off the N103. Several picnic tables, water, garbage. Only suitable for a short stopover.

title: (5300) Bragança Municipality - R. de Säo Francisco
title_short: (5300) Bragança Municipality - R. de Säo Francisco
description: A municipal place of first quality with supply and disposal. Only found the entrance on the 2nd attempt, it is a little before the coordinates in the navigation system. If vehicles are parked there, they can be seen from the street. A few more parking spaces are behind it, just continue on the driveway. Beautiful view, tranquility, an old castell (or village) on the hill. There is a public toilet (round door) at the cemetery parking lot around the corner.

title: (5300) Bragança - R. de São Francisco
description: Parking type bus, with very long seats, perfect for 7.40 m and! No signs prohibiting the parking of motorhomes. The GNR has passed several times and has not stopped to ask us to clear the scene. Super quiet night! Anticipate lateral wedging! Parking breakdown when the municipal (nearby) is saturated.

title: (5300) Bragança - 166 Avenida João da Cruz
description: Free parking

title: (5160) - Unnamed Road
description:
Beautiful and calm spot near a chapel. The place was recently restored with a swings that serves like a viewpoint.
There are public toilets, but unfortunately were closed.
Possible to sleep if you can.

title: (5300) Bragança - 427 Rua das Quintas da Seara
title_short: (5300) Bragança - 427 Rua das Quintas da Seara

title: (5300-067) Bragança - 9 Rua Capitão Salgueiro Maia

title: (5430) - Unnamed Road
description: Visited site May 2022. A slightly odd and eerie place. Satnav took us up a very steep unmade road. At the top we found a disused and vandalised toilet block, some very old children’s play equipment and a view. No water. We didn’t stay. We left by a made up road, poor condition, past the old church which, if we had found first, we might have stayed but earlier experience put us off.

title: (5160) Cilhade - Unnamed road
description: Parking at a dam. No amenities, but perfect for an overnight stay. Along a very busy road, one or two cars per hour during rush hour. We thought it was delicious.

name: Cepo Verde
title: (5300-561) Cepo Verde
description: In the heart of Montesinho Natural Park, and 10 minutes away from the city of Bragança, the camping site is located in a mountain highland, filled with chestnut trees, oak trees and cherry trees and in a place recognised as an ancient Roman settlement. The campsite has individual spaces, with abundant shadows, and it provides a bar and restaurant open all year, with delicious traditional meals, homemade soup and pizzas done every day. In permanent exhibition at the bar/restaurant the world´s largest pocketknife with more than 2 meters high, registered int the Guiness World Records Book (original certificate exposed). The campers have full access to barbecue facilities outside. The park also has a traditional wood-fired oven in which bread is baked once a week. It is possible to pick cherries in June and July, and mushrooms in May and June, inside and outside the park. Offering a fantastic landscape and night scenery, the park is also a few minutes away from various signalled trails. Operating since 1993, this is a very quiet and family-friendly park.

title: (5300) Donai - R. da Eira
description: Parking in the village, a bit leaning.

name: Biospot do Parque Biológico de Vinhais-Sede
title: (5320) Biospot do Parque Biológico de Vinhais-Sede
title_short: (5320) Biospot do Parque Biológico de Vinhais-Sede
description: Biological Park of Vinhais. Payment possible by credit card. Gray water drain. Drain black waters. Reloading in water. Shower. Toilet. Electricity. Washing done by the staff (ask the reception). Activities: Playground for children, Swimming (natural swimming pool), hiking (starting from two paths), tree climbing, zipline, climbing, visit of the park, paintball.

title: (5400-658) Oucidres -
description: Beautiful mountain view in a small Portuguese village quiet place without disturbance pleasant to live.

title: (5300) Quintanilha -
description:
Great barbecue and picnic area around a hermitage. The highway sounds in the background but it doesn't bother. Tables in the shade of hundred-year-old trees. Trash. Fountain. WC.
Today he is clean and at peace. There is not a single toilet paper on the floor. Please, make it clean again. If you urinate or excrete, put the paper and excrement in a bag and throw it in the garbage container

You will find garbage cans in the village as well as a park for children and water.

Thank you for respecting the places as well as the inhabitants.

title: (5300) Restaurante O Rústico
description: Caravela! Restaurant and parking the Rustico. Private parking with water and table and possibility of toilet in the restaurant. Restaurant and village center (60 people) held by Adelaide and Amendio and their son Alex who speak French very well. Nice restaurant to eat a good rib of beef. Warm and friendly welcome. Very quiet and relaxing place.

title: (5160) Torre de Moncorvo - Unnamed Road
description: Point of view with bins a little higher. Possibility of parking but on holds. Magnificent view. Thank you for respecting the places! Miradouro Santa Leocádia

title: (5160) - Rua da Romanzeira
description: Beautiful quiet place on top of a hill next to a church with a view of Moncorvo. There are toilets for which you can ask the keys at the tourist office, and there are bbqs to use, with shelter and tables.

title: (5160) Estudante de Freixo -
description:
Vast, relatively flat land next to a ruin.
The not very busy road is 15m away.
Some rubbish but not too much.
We only picnicked there.
Sporadic 4G.

title: (5320) Nuzedo -
description: Super nice place to watch the setting sun, I stayed there one night and day without any problems

title: () Q.Ta Da Macieirinha - Unnamed Road
description: Beautiful place off the road in the middle of the broom. Unpaved access suitable for smaller discreet van. Lonely quiet

title: (5160) - N102
description: At the edge of the Douro, 2 boats at the dock, in front of the beach, quiet and shaded area for a van or 2. no services but shower and toilet on the beach 5 min.

title: (37253) Aldeadávila de la Ribera - Unnamed Road
title_short: (37253) Aldeadávila de la Ribera - Unnamed Road
description: Parking in the middle of nature next to the viewpoints of Arribes del Duero.

title: (5140) Carrazeda de Ansiães - CM1141
description: Large shaded picnic area with barbecue, fitness trail, no sign prohibition camping car No services Not far from the pool

title: (37253) Aldeadávila de la Ribera - Unnamed Road
title_short: (37253) Aldeadávila de la Ribera - Unnamed Road
description: This is called "el prado de la bodega". Nice place with views, swings, barbecues etc.

title: (5400) Travancas -
description: A little shady - Nice little spot for eating or resting and swimming opposite - (this water point was later added as a recreation area and a fishing area) - my truck is 7 m - and ideal for the vans

title: (5180) - Unnamed Road
description: Tarmac parking overlooking the Douro Valley

title: (5160) Torre de Moncorvo - IP2
description: Nice parking spot next to a big lake with small mountains. Beautiful scenery! A bay next to the road. During day you hear cars, at night quiet. Great for a stop over rest.

title: (5400-745) Santo António de Monforte -
description: Place to stop motorhomes near the nogueirinha reservoir easy access from here on foot to the water. Very quiet night and beautiful view over the city of Chaves.

title: (5140) -
description: Place flat with a pontoon for swimming, very beautiful view in peace. Great hike nearby .. (Trilho de Sao lourenço)

title: (5300) Bragança - Unnamed Road
description: Continuing the track (some tricky passages for our rocker) just before a small factory or factory in ruins ... Very quiet, rare walkers, the stream at 30 meters

title: (5300) - Rua da Igreja
description: A small secluded parking space by the river and next to a park. Quiet evening and night. Public toilets not too far.

title: (37253) Salto de Aldeadávila - 56 Calle Poblado del Salto
title_short: (37253) Salto de Aldeadávila - 56 Calle Poblado del Salto
description: Beautiful place with a garden, picnic areas, and a spectacular view of the Duero, right at the bottom of the Aldeadávila dam, to spend an afternoon picnic. The 12 km route. from the junction of the main road it is very nice to reach the end.

title: (37250) Aldeadávila de la Ribera - Playa del Rostro
title_short: (37250) Aldeadávila de la Ribera - Playa del Rostro
description: Very beautiful site to preserve imperatively. The end of the journey can be tricky for motorhomes but buses go down to 800 m from the river.

title: (5180) Fornos - Unnamed Road
description: Amazing point of view to spot eagles and other birds!

name: Camping Las Casitas de las Arribes
title: (37250) Camping Las Casitas de las Arribes
title_short: (37250) Camping Las Casitas de las Arribes
description: Very natural, pleasant and unbeatable personal treatment. New camping and above all clean. Recommended

title: () Moimenta - Lgo do Toural
description: For lovers of peaceful villages, there is Moimenta. Sloping pitches, need to stall. No shadow. No service except a water point. The baker has passed around 11:30! Departure of an 8km hike through a beautiful bathing spot.

title: (5320) Moimenta - 45 Rua da Gasparona
description: Picnic area on the edge of a pretty river, too cute corner. we just had lunch there but I think it is possible to stay there one night because nothing prohibits it. there is a barbecue and lighting

title: (5320-070) Vinhais - Unnamed Road
description: Viewpoint next to Moimenta, a little path not suitable for motorhomes / bus. Flat place between granites, very quiet.

title: (37254) Mieza -
description: Parking lot very quiet, well leveled and with some trees that provide shade. A few meters from the Code viewpoint from where you can see spectacular views of the Douro River and a picnic area. With little light pollution which allows you to observe the stars.

title: (5150) Vila Nova de Foz Côa - Unnamed Road
title_short: (5150) Vila Nova de Foz Côa - Unnamed Road
description: Large paved parking lot next to a jetty on the Douro River. Quiet place to rest and spend the night. Without services.

title: (5160) Rio Douro - IP2
description: Parking area next to old road/railway bridge. Nice views of the damn too. Bridge is an interesting walk but it says no pedistrians so definitely take care and be careful.

title: (5300) - EM1026
description: Very quiet place on the side of a forest road, In Montesinho there was no hollow for the motorhome and there is very flat hollow. There is no photo because I forgot to do it before I left, but this is very good, if someone can climb a perfect

title: (37250) Aldeadávila de la Ribera -
description: Esplanade next to the El Rocoso Recreational Area. Fairly well leveled. Quiet place, I imagine not so much in summer. It has a shower, a poolside snack bar and bathrooms only open in summer.

title: (5150-501) Vila Nova de Foz Côa - Unnamed Road
title_short: (5150-501) Vila Nova de Foz Côa - Unnamed Road
description:
PLEASE READ THE INTRODUCTION BEFORE CLAIMING ABOUT THINGS.

Beautiful and calm place to stay one night. There are public toilets (probably closed), a lot of little uneven shaded places to park, and an astonishing landscape to the Douro river. Near by you can find a fishing spot, a river beach without guard. You can also take a boat trip in "Embarcação Senhora da Veiga" on the other side of the dam just take a look in the website of the city council. I added this place because is in my hometown and I downloaded the photo from google just to show you the view from the chapel. Hope you enjoy it!

title: (5150) Vila Nova de Foz Côa - 10 IP2
title_short: (5150) Vila Nova de Foz Côa - 10 IP2
description: Flat tarmac car park adjacent to the hydro baragem of the Douro river.

title: (5300) Bragança - EM1026
description: Small dominant location, in front of an abandoned building, surrounded by trees and about 200 meters from the hamlet of Montesinho. Accessible to all templates, satellite reception and 4G optimal, but no service. The place is calm, stabilized and generally level. A bivouac in the nature conducive to rest.

title: (37254) Mieza - Unnamed Road
description: Picnic area near the belvedere of Mieza “Peña el Aguilar”. Flat land in the middle of nature, very quiet. Possibility to spend the night there.

title: (5150) Vila Nova de Foz Côa - Unnamed Road
title_short: (5150) Vila Nova de Foz Côa - Unnamed Road
description: A calm and peaceful place on the banks of the Douro, possibility of swimming. Easy access to any vehicle.

title: (5180) - Unnamed Road
description: Picnic area with barbecue, sanitary facilities, water. Pontoon for boat and launch. The places are not in an exemplary state of cleanliness.

title: (49572) Hermisende - ZA-L-2698
description: Hermisende, recreation area with natural pool, very quiet, shade, lawn, no services, small fountain. Narrow access through the village and even narrower on a magnificent 2.5m long bridge, telephone coverage, TV and Internet 4G, only Portuguese radio

title: (37254) Mieza - 42 Calle Carretera
description: Authorized stay, 72 hours. Tables, chairs, awning, etc ... are not allowed. The town center and the hotel, shopping, pharmacy, etc ... services are about 300 m away. Next to the area there is a playground and a sports area with a pediment and a soccer field.

title: (5150) Vila Nova de Foz Côa - N324
title_short: (5150) Vila Nova de Foz Côa - N324
description: Fill well with grid for canister without thread

title: (5300) - N103-7
description: For small van or cell 4x4 ... really quiet place and flat, just after the border, there is a house (forest?) On the left and 70 / 80m further AT RIGHT a small path that goes back obliquely in the opposite direction, so turn wide ... and drive for 50m. This location is not visible from the road and there is very little traffic at night. Sleep guaranteed! 3 to 5 places.

title: (5180-160) Freixo de Espada - 221 N221
description: On the heights of Freixos de Espeda in Cinta, in the forest...several possibilities of pitches...very calm and beautiful view...for one night it's cool.

title: (5300) - Unnamed Road
description: In the heart of the Montesinho natural park, perfect for taking walks.

title: (5300) Calabor - Unnamed Road
description: Flat parking up in the hills by the reservoir. Gravel track up from crossroads outside village but good road for the dam. Road to Montesinho is small. Lovely spot for a walk in the hills

title: (5180) - Unnamed Road
description: Small plateau on the roadside, in the middle of agricultural land - but not private. Evening and morning sun. No water. No toilets. No banks. Just rest - half hour and full hour carillon from the village. Not really offroad. But green trees are often garbage :(

title: (5180) Freixo de Espada à Cinta -
description: 380° view stone picnic tables and benches in absolute calm shade drinking water tap very spacious parking possible almost flat, 4 G, partial view of the Douro.

title: (5300) France -
description: This cul-de-sac ends just before the border area with Spain. Along it some bulges suitable for standing. 1350 m high, ideal to escape the heat in the valley. According to a local, you won't be disturbed if you stay the night here.

title: (37258) Vilvestre - Camoino de la Barca
description: Starting point for a river trip at 12 noon all year round. And only in August, a second ride at 5 p.m. Beautiful picnic area in the shade of trees, garbage cans, public toilets. Magnificent view of the Duero. It must be possible to spend a night there. Warning: It is forbidden to park in the enclosure of the picnic area. Vehicles must be left in the last bend (only a few parking lots).

name: Area de Serviço Autocaravanas
title: (5180-164) Area de Serviço Autocaravanas
description: Area in a closed park. Go through the gate with sliding door, go to the bottom of the park then to the left. Free services, electricity included.

title: (5160) - Unnamed Road
description: Chapel of Senhora do Castelo Chapel with a natural 360 degree miradouro.

title: (5150) Vila Nova de Foz Côa -
description: Miradouro da estrada da costa

title: (37258) Vilvestre - 72 Calle Castillo
description: Castle viewpoint. Near the town of Vilvestre, next to the remains of the castle. Impressive views over the Duero. Beautiful sunset. A couple of shaded granite tables and benches and a flat esplanade for parking.

title: (5180) Freixo de Espada à Cinta - Unnamed Road
title_short: (5180) Freixo de Espada à Cinta - Unnamed Road
description: Viewpoint on the way to the river beach of Congida. Nice views and place to eat. No shade, no services. It is worth stopping and taking in the views.

title: (5150) Vila Nova de Foz Côa - Unnamed Road
title_short: (5150) Vila Nova de Foz Côa - Unnamed Road
description: Small quiet place at the edge of the Douro on the old railway. Only one location, not far from the archaeological museum walk by steep path. For van or van medium road and sloping.

title: () Vila Nova de Foz Côa - 1 Largo São Sebastião
title_short: () Vila Nova de Foz Côa - 1 Largo São Sebastião
description: Quiet and clean area.

title: (5150) Vila Nova de Foz Côa - Unnamed Road
title_short: (5150) Vila Nova de Foz Côa - Unnamed Road
description: Parking archaeological museum of the Coa Valley. Many parking spaces, dishes. No shade. Point of view on the Douro at the end of the museum.

title: (5150) Vila Nova de Foz Côa -
description: Open space on the road to the Coa museum. wonderful 360° vew on the hills. no gates or fences. very quietexcept for occasional cars passing buy (not many, especially after museum closes). plenty of space for several motorhomes. flat. no trees. a bit windy.

title: (5150) Vila Nova de Foz Côa - 43 Rua Engenheiro Eugénio Nobre
title_short: (5150) Vila Nova de Foz Côa - 43 Rua Engenheiro Eugénio Nobre
description: Estacionamento muito bem localizado, com serviços,  wc e água... pena ter um canil municipal ao pé, com muitos cães inquietos e barulhentos e uma rua com algum trânsito noturno... Parabéns à autarquia pelo empenho, limpeza e cuidado desta área. Obrigado!

title: (5180-133) Freixo de Espada à Cinta - Unnamed Road
title_short: (5180-133) Freixo de Espada à Cinta - Unnamed Road
description: Great place for day parking, near a beautiful river beach. Water and toilets around.

title: (5150-566) Vila Nova de Foz Côa - 14 Avenida Cidade Nova
title_short: (5150-566) Vila Nova de Foz Côa - 14 Avenida Cidade Nova
description:
Self service laundry.
Dryer

title: () - Unnamed Road
description: Praia Fluvial de Congide (River beach). Very calm. Swimming pool, water, swimming, avoid weekends. 3/4 places on the track at the bottom.

title: () - Unnamed Road
description: Slightly sloping terrain, rocky. Magnificent view at 360 degrees because at 700m altitude. Watch out for the wind ...

title: (32549) A Mezquita - Estrada Mezquita - Vilavella
description: Picnic area in the countryside. Very shady. Quiet night, no problem. Has a natural water spring with drinking water. Have been drinking without problems.

title: (49570) Lubián - Viaducto del Rio Tuela
description: Picnic area next to the river beach of Lubián (Zamora). With picnic tables, barbecues and wastebaskets. It is under the highway but it is very quiet.

title: (49573) Lubián - ZA-106
description: Quiet place to stop undisturbed. Views over the ports of Padornelo and La Canda. Fountain with water all year round. Cross with the Camino de Santiago. I haven't slept, but I guess it can be done without problems. A few kilometers away there are towns with bars, such as Lubian, through which they will have trouble passing very long vehicles. The road from the Zamorano side is sloping, winding and narrow, with a lot of potholes, and some trucks from the AVE works circulate along it. Access from the Galician side does not offer difficulties.
